text: Ray Reardon (8 October 1932 â€“ 19 July 2024) was a Welsh snooker player who dominated his sport in the seventies of the 20th Century. He won the World Championship six times. Before he was a snooker player he was a professional policeman and miner. He started his career in 1967, and ended in 1992. Reardon died of cancer on 19 July 2024, at the age of 91. ==References== == Other websites == * Ray Reardon at World Snooker Category:1932 births Category:2024 deaths Category:British snooker players Category:Welsh sportspeople
title: Ray Reardon
